Computes the adjusted p-values

Source: R/DiffAnalysis.R
diffAnaComputeAdjustedPValues.Rd

This function is a wrapper to the function adjust.p from the cp4p package. It returns the adjusted p-values corresponding to the p-values of the differential analysis. The adjusted p-values is computed with the function p.adjust{stats}.

Usage

diffAnaComputeAdjustedPValues(pval, pi0Method = 1)

Arguments

pval

The result (p-values) of the differential analysis

pi0Method

The parameter pi0.method of the method adjust.p in the package cp4p

Value

The computed adjusted p-values

Author

Samuel Wieczorek

Examples

data(subR25prot)
obj <- subR25prot
# Simulate imputation
obj <- NAIsZero(obj, 1)
obj <- NAIsZero(obj, 2)
allComp <- limmaCompleteTest(
SummarizedExperiment::assay(obj[[length(obj)]]), design.qf(obj), 
comp.type="OnevsOne")
diffAnaComputeAdjustedPValues(pval = allComp$P_Value[, 1])
#> Procedure of Benjamini-Hochberg is used. pi0 is fixed to 1.
